es.csic.iiia.nsm.agent.language

Class TaxonomyOfTerms

  • java.lang.Object
    • es.csic.iiia.nsm.agent.language.TaxonomyOfTerms
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Taxonomy

    public class TaxonomyOfTerms
extends java.lang.Object
implements Taxonomy
    A taxonomy of terms that represents the domain of a predicate
    Author:
    "Javier Morales (jmorales@iiia.csic.es)"
    See Also:
    Taxonomy

      • getGeneralisationLevel

        public int getGeneralisationLevel(java.lang.String term)
        Returns the level of generalisation of the given term in the taxonomy (i.e., the domain). The generalisation level indicates the position (i.e., height) of the term in the taxonomy. As an example, while a "leaf" term in the taxonomy has level 0, its immediate parent has level 1, and the parent of the parent has level 2
        Specified by:
        getGeneralisationLevel in interface Taxonomy
        Parameters:
        term - the term
        Returns:
        the level of generalisation of the given term in the taxonomy

      • isTop

        public boolean isTop(java.lang.String term)
        Returns true if the given term is in the top of the taxonomy. In other words, it returns true if the term is the most general term in the taxonomy
        Specified by:
        isTop in interface Taxonomy
        Parameters:
        term - the term
        Returns:
        true if the given term is in the top of the taxonomy
